intro: Christella jinghongensis, commonly known as the Jinghong Christella, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
